title.value: The Brain-Computer Metaphor Debate Is Useless: A Matter of Semantics
title.justification: The title of the paper is clearly stated at the beginning of the article and in the citation information.
title.quote: Richards BA and Lillicrap TP (2022) The Brain-Computer Metaphor Debate Is Useless: A Matter of Semantics.

extractions.description: The paper argues that the debate over the brain-computer metaphor is a matter of semantics due to differing definitions of 'computer' used within and outside of computer science. It suggests resolving this by clarifying the context in which the definition is used, encouraging researchers to engage with computer science's expansive definition where the brain is considered a literal computer, while acknowledging the limitations of traditional computer metaphors.

type.justification: The paper discusses definitions, semantics, and philosophical perspectives rather than conducting empirical research or experiments.
type.quote: In this paper, we adopt a perspective that focuses on the use of words for understanding their meaning.

name.justification: The paper was submitted to the Theoretical Computer Science section of the journal and discusses theoretical and semantic aspects surrounding definitions in computer science.
name.quote: This article was submitted to Theoretical Computer Science, a section of the journal Frontiers in Computer Science.
